p: The recorded data were analyzed using SPSS software (version 16.0 for Windows), and statistical significance (significance level was considered p < .05) among parameters in each day was evaluated by one‐way analysis of variance (ANOVA) and followed by Tukey test. Trends of changes in each treatment in different days were analyzed statistically using repeated measure test. After that, results were declared as mean value with their standard deviation (mean ± SD). The normality of the data was evaluated by one‐sample Kolmogorov–Smirnov test. All measurements were performed in triplicate (Khanjari et al., 2019).
